references.name: Louie Bacaj
references.reference: I worked with Ido for close to three years at jet.com, he was in fact one of the earliest employees of Jet. In that time Ido worked across many areas of the jet.com tech stack and wore many hats. He built and, in many ways, introduced Micro Services in F# to Jet, he built parts of the core eCommerce platform, he worked on developer productivity tooling among many other areas. At the time, when Jet started, many things did not exist to support a large-scale cloud deployment and Ido was not afraid to jump in and build large scale systems such as our Micro Service orchestration tool, Torch, from the ground up. These early tools and libraries would prove incredibly valuable as Jet continued to grow and scale. It is not a stretch for me to say that I have not worked with anyone like Ido in the past that possess this level of expertise with such a wide breadth of technologies. Ido also made some incredibly valuable contributions to my career early on by sitting down with me and teaching me F# and helping me get acquainted with the state-of-the-art platform Jet was building for eCommerce. This all speaks volumes to Idoâ€™s leadership abilities to mentor and help others grow.

references.name: Mike Hanrahan
references.reference: Ido is someone who has an incredible mind for engineering.   He drove the architecture of the very successful ecommerce platform that we built at Jet.com, especially in the event driven nature of how it was architected.  Ido's deep technical understanding of distributed systems, CAP theorem and related topics meant that he was ideal in thinking through how we implemented comprehensive geo redundancy in the platform.   Additionally, Ido always brought a unique perspective to problem solving and was seen as a thought leader within the group.  He manages to combine theory with practical execution to quickly bring technically sound solutions to life.

references.name: Steven Cipolla
references.reference: I worked with Ido in two capacities at hi5: First, I was responsible for testing the commerce system which Ido developed with a few other engineers. It was clear that Ido took the lead on that project and the team produced a high quality product. Later I worked side-by-side with Ido on the development team. In that time he was a mentor: I learned more about software architecture in my two months working with Ido than at any other time in my schooling or career. We constantly challenged each other to write better software. As a team member, Ido makes everyone around him a better developer.

references.name: Svetlozar Petrov
references.reference: Ido is easily one of the best software engineers I have had the chance to work with. His broad knowledge and experience are impressive and his passion for software development catching. Ido is a great team player, an inspiring leader and without doubt he will be a perfect addition to any team.

references.name: Ismail Kacimi
references.reference: It was a total pleasure working with Ido, he is one of the smartest engineer I have ever worked with and on top of that he is very dedicated to what he does and he really enjoys it. I would not think twice to work with him again. If I had to start a company some day, he will be one of the first people Ill ask to join, he knows how to get stuff done and find solutions to the most complicated problems. He is a brilliant engineer and a .net expert.

references.name: Saurabh Shah
references.reference: Ido is definitely one of the smartest person I have met so far. He is a great software engineer with tremendous experience which is demonstrated through his ideas regarding everything ranging from high level architecture and design to writing and debugging code. He also is a great team player, willing to help out with any task necessary to achieve and maintain team velocity. There must have been a number of occasions where he has been pivotal in achieving sprint goals and hitting product deadlines. His thinking style and his passion for technology has been very influential on me and he would be a great asset to any organization.

references.name: Gadi Lenz
references.reference: Ido is one of the brightest people I have had the pleasure to work with. As such, I found him to be someone who I could discuss many technical issues with and the dialog would produce great results. references.name: Ariel Raunstien
references.reference: I've known Ido for a long time and since our professional ways parted - I have noticed I miss his insights and technical contribution. Ido is a master programmer, and he leverages all of those skills to be a great system architect. If you work on a large scale project, and can get in touch with Ido for feedback - do so now. :)

references.name: Roy Osherove
references.reference: Ido is a hard working and technically curious person. He can take a complex subject and master it fast. He'd be an asset as a technical specialist if you can satisfy his need for interesting things to do. Lastly, he *loves* technology. It's hard to find someone who really loves doing this and is *good* at it at the same time. Ido is one of those people.
